parse: Conjunction
str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Preposition
str2: On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Conjunction
str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Preposition
str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Verb - Aorist Infinitive Middle
str2: To appoint, choose, elect, take into hand.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From hupo and a derivative of eresso; an under-oarsman, i.e. subordinate.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
